colourTooltip.string: Changes the color of the pen.

continue.description: button - Closes the dialog and continues to the next level

instructions1_1.string: I'm a turtle with chalk on my belly. Stack up blocks and press "Run Program" to make me draw the shown picture.

instructions1_10.string: Draw anything you want. Some ideas are a stick figure, snowflake, or spiral.  You could also try out the new "set width" block.  Have fun!

instructions1_2.string: Draw a square, making each side a different color.

instructions1_3.string: Make a square using only 3 blocks.  (Remember that blocks to set color are free.)

instructions1_4.string: Draw a triangle whose sides are all 100 dots and are in random colors.  You'll have to figure out how far to turn.

instructions1_5.string: Draw a triangle and then a square to draw an envelope.

instructions1_6.string: Can you figure out how draw this triangle and square?

instructions1_7.string: See if you can draw these green glasses.

instructions1_8.string: After trying out these blocks, see what happens if you make them repeat 8 times.  It should look a little different every time you run it.

instructions1_9.string: Figure out what number to replace the question marks with to draw a circle.

instructions2_1.string: Find the familiar blocks in the new categories to draw a square in your favorite color.

instructions2_10.string: Draw whatever you want.  One idea is experimenting with different types of spirals.  What happens if you change the turn amount, rather than the move amount?  TODO: Add starting blocks.

instructions2_2.string: Use the new "draw a square" block, found in the "Functions" category, to draw a small green square.

instructions2_3.string: Use the "repeat" block to draw 3 squares of size 100, each 120 degrees apart, in random colors.

instructions2_4.string: Now change the code to draw 36 squares, each 10 degrees apart.

instructions2_5.string: Draw squares with sides of 50, 60, 70, 80, and 90 dots.  You'll need lots of blocks.

instructions2_6.string: Modify this program with the "counter" block (found in the Variables category) to draw the same series of squares with fewer blocks than on the previous level.

instructions2_7.string: Replace the pale (disabled) blocks with a "count with" block (in the Loops category) and "counter" block (in the Variables category) to draw the same spiral.

instructions2_8.string: Draw three snowmen 150 dots tall in different colors, 100 dots apart.  Use the new "draw a snowman" function and "jump forward" block.

instructions2_9.string: Use a "count with" loop to draw a family of snowmen with heights of 110, 100, 90, 80, and 70 dots, each 60 dots apart.

instructions3_1.string: You can now see how the "draw a square" and "draw a circle" functions are defined.  Defining a function doesn't run its blocks.  You have to pull out the "draw a square" block to actually draw a square.

instructions3_10.string: You're now free to do whatever you want.  One idea is to try running this program with different turn amounts (higher or lower than 90).  Other ideas are to draw a star, circle, heart, or animal.

instructions3_2.string: Using the "draw a square" function as an example, create a "draw a triangle" function and use it.

instructions3_3.string: Draw triangular fences around the cats and a square fence around the cow.  Tip: Test the program as you go along.

instructions3_4.string: See if you can figure out how to use "draw a square" and "draw a triangle" (and some other blocks) to draw a house around the lion.

instructions3_5.string: Now create a "draw a house" function and use it house two cats.

instructions3_6.string: Using "draw a square" as an example, add an input named "length" to "draw a triangle".  Then, draw triangles in different colors around the animals.

instructions3_7.string: Add a "height" input to "draw a house" and build a big house for the elephant.

instructions3_8.string: Here are all of the blocks from the previous level.  Modify "draw a house" so the turtle ends up at the bottom right corner of the new house.  Use this modified function to house all the animals.

instructions3_9.string: Use a "count with" block and your code from the previous level to draw houses of size 50, 100, and 150 in different colors.

instructions4_1.string: Now you have learned how to draw different shapes, can you create a program that draws the house you made with tangram pieces?

instructions4_2.string: Now you have learned how to draw different shapes, can you create a program that draws the square you made with two triangles?

instructions4_3.string: Now you have learned how to draw different shapes, can you create a program that draws the arrow you made with tangram pieces?

instructions4_4.string: Now you have learned how to draw different shapes, can you create a program that draws the ship you made with tangram pieces?

jumpForwardTooltip.string: Moves the turtle forward without leaving any marks.

moveTooltip.string: Moves the turtle forward or backward by the specified amount.

notBlackColour.string: You need to set a color other than black for this level.

numBlocksNeeded.string: This level can be solved with %1 blocks.  You used %2.

penTooltip.string: Lifts or lowers the pen, to start or stop drawing.

tooFewColours.string: You need to use at least %1 different colors on this level.  You used only %2.

tryAgain.description: button - Closes the dialog and stays on the current level

turnRightTooltip.string: Turns the turtle right by the specified angle.

turnTooltip.string: Turns the turtle left or right by the specified number of degrees.

turtleVisibilityTooltip.string: Makes the turtle (green circle and arrow) visible or invisible.

widthTooltip.string: Changes the width of the pen.

wrongColour.string: Your picture is the wrong color.  For this level, it needs to be %1.
